name: Thai Fried Pork Belly Recipe
description: Thai fried pork belly recipe, perfectly crisp and juicy pork belly every time!

recipeInstructions.text: Make a large incision in the fatty part of the pork belly to help the fat render properly. Sprinkle with salt and let it rest for 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Make a large incision in the fatty part of the pork belly to help the fat render properly. Sprinkle with salt and let it rest for 20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In a deep wok or pot, submerge the pork belly in water and boil over medium heat for 15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: In a deep wok or pot, submerge the pork belly in water and boil over medium heat for 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Once boiled, take the pork belly out and continuously prick the skin with a fork; this helps render the fat and leads to a crisper finish.
recipeInstructions.name: Once boiled, take the pork belly out and continuously prick the skin with a fork; this helps render the fat and leads to a crisper finish.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the pork belly skin-side down in a dish and cover the skin with a very thin layer of vinegar for 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the pork belly skin-side down in a dish and cover the skin with a very thin layer of vinegar for 20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a wok or skillet, then carefully add the pork belly. Cover and fry each side for 5 minutes over medium heat, watching for splatters.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a wok or skillet, then carefully add the pork belly. Cover and fry each side for 5 minutes over medium heat, watching for splatters.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the pork belly cool, then fry skin-side down over high heat for 2 minutes with a lid on to achieve a crispy skin.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the pork belly cool, then fry skin-side down over high heat for 2 minutes with a lid on to achieve a crispy skin.

recipeInstructions.text: Allow the meat to rest for a few minutes after frying to let the juices settle, then slice and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Allow the meat to rest for a few minutes after frying to let the juices settle, then slice and serve.

review.reviewBody: This an amazingly tasty dish! The crispy pork paired with Nan Jim Jeaw dipping sauce is exceptional. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a simple and quick dish!
